intro: Perityle villosa, commonly known as the hairy perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Perityle villosa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil.
